p: Apple pomace, which includes soft tissues, core, stems, seeds, and peels, is a good source of polyphenols such as chlorogenic acid ( Figure 8A), hydroxycinnamates ( Figure 8B), quercetin ( Figure 8C), and catechin ( Figure 8D) [ 13, 62]. Studies show a wide variation in the polyphenolic content of different apple cultivars. The main compounds present in the polyphenolic fraction of apples were catechins and proanthocyanidins followed by hydroxycinnamates, flavonols, dihydrochalcones, and anthocyanins [ 63]. However, the number of individual compounds varies up to 30% from one year to another in the same cultivar [ 64].
